data.title: Putnam Teams and Results | Faculty of Mathematics 50th Anniversary
data.meta_description: The William Lowell Putnam Mathematical Competition is an annual competition for universities from Canada and the United States – wid
data.text:
The William Lowell Putnam Mathematical Competition is an annual competition for universities from Canada and the United States – widely considered to be the most prestigious mathematical competition in the world.

Undergraduate students may compete individually, but each institution's official team consists of three students. Since 1968, the University of Waterloo has participated and placed well in the Putnam competition. Several were awarded as being a Putnam Fellow (one of the top five ranked students in the competition), and many teams placed as one of the top fiveuniversities.

Below are all the Waterloo students that were a Putnam Fellow, awarded the Elizabeth Lowell Putnam Prize, and who were part of a high-ranked university team.

Individual Putnam Fellows

Name Year Won Daniel Spivak 2015 Ralph C. Furmaniak 2003 Sabin Cautis 1999 Derek I. E. Kisman 1999 Colin M. Springer 1989 David W. Ash 1981-1983 Grant M. Roberts 1974

Elizabeth Lowell Putnam Prize

Name Year Won Wai Ling Yee 1999
